Articles.Content:
Hey guys, there was in idea in my mind for a long time, i decided to make a suggestion for it;

Color filters! As many of you know, similar engined game "Cities Skylines" has color filter option where you can select filters to apply, so i thought why ksp cant do that too? They both have same engine, Unity 5!

Imagine doing a moon landing mission with Black & White filter, or saturated flight in Laythe? Wouldnt it be pretty?.

Here are some screenshots to help your imagination;

 

Soo, what do you think, worth to implement?

3 minutes ago, qromodynmc said:

Soo, what do you think, worth to implement?

Maybe, yes.  But not now.  Unless it's something built into Unity that they can knock out in an hour.  Cities is a Unity 5 game, but it also has a lot less problems than KSP.

Edited August 23, 2016 by Alshain

3 minutes ago, Alshain said:

Maybe, yes.  But not now.  Unless it's something built into Unity that they can knock out in an hour.  Cities is a Unity 5 game, but it also has a lot less problems than KSP.

Yeah mine is just an idea, it doesnt look very complex to build but i dont know very well.
Might be best for a mod.
Probably not hard, you can jam extra processing stages in the U5 render pipe - the UI for it would probably take the longest. Best done as a mod, though.

Nice idea, and I can see it being of interest, but thats the sort if thing id want to do afterwards, not during play.  And don't most computers come with crude photo editing software that can do this anyway?

Might be a cool thing if you couple it with the Historian mod.

BUT I also think if cameras ever make their way into the stock game they should totally have the ability to do that. 60-like photos, black and white, UV light only, infrared, x-ray and all those cool things that are being used in telescopes.

To be exact, im not suggesting this for just taking photos, for my taste ksp looks bit desaturated or lacking contrast, adding color filter or adjustable color option would help people with different monitors (especially laptops since they have little bad time with colors)

Unfortunately, Unity3D doesn't have these colour filters built in, they are custom shaders that have to be either written by the devs or added from a 3rd party.

KSP is about rockets and little green aliens, instagram style filters are novel but aren't really part of the scope for the game, sorry.
